sections.heading: records; duty to keep.The clerk of the court shall keep the records, books and papers appertaining to the court, and record its proceedings
sections.text: SourceR.S.1867, Code § 887, p. 548;R.S.1913, § 8556;C.S.1922, § 9507;C.S.1929, § 20-2208;R.S.1943, § 25-2208.AnnotationsSection is mandatory and clerk must make

sections.heading: mandatory and clerk must make complete record, though fees and costs not tendered. State v. Several Parcels of Land, 82 Neb. 51, 117 N.W. 450 (1908).
sections.text: mandatory and clerk must make complete record, though fees and costs not tendered. State v. Several Parcels of Land, 82 Neb. 51, 117 N.W. 450 (1908).
